title: Number of Outback Steakhouse restaurants worldwide from 2011 to 2018 , by location
summary: This is a multi-line chart with 2 lines representing United States, and International. The y axis denotes Number of restaurants and the x axis denotes Year.
Overall International is gradually increasing, United States is gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. United States, and lastly, 2. International.
Overall across the Year, United States mostly maintained the highest Number of restaurants when compared to others with a mean value of 756.38, and it peaked at 2011.
The botommost line, International,  has a mean of 225.62, and peaked at 2018.

max_summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 2 lines denoting United States, and International. The y axis indicates the Number of restaurants and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall International is gradually increasing, United States is gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Number of restaurants in descending order is: 1. United States, and lastly, 2. International.
Overall across the Year, United States mostly maintained the highest Number of restaurants when compared to others with a mean value of 756.38, and it peaked at 2011.
The botommost line, International,  has a mean of 225.62, and peaked at 2018.
International reported the lowest Number of restaurants about 191.0 in Year 2011
The greatest difference of Number of restaurants between United States and International occurs at Year 2011 and the smallest difference occurs at 2018.
